meanings.definition: To dip or splash lightly in water or liquid.
meanings.sent1: The child dabbled his toes in the shallow pool.
meanings.sent2: She dabbled her paintbrush in the water before starting to paint.
meanings.sent3: The cat dabbled its paw in the fishbowl, trying to catch the fish.
meanings.sent4: The sunlight dabbled through the leaves, creating a beautiful pattern on the ground.
meanings.sent5: The rain dabbled softly on the window, lulling her to sleep.

meanings.definition: To take part in an activity in a casual or superficial way.
meanings.sent1: He dabbled in photography but never pursued it seriously.
meanings.sent2: She dabbled in gardening by planting a few flowers in her backyard.
meanings.sent3: The student dabbled in different sports before finding his passion in basketball.
meanings.sent4: Her mind dabbled in thoughts of travel, imagining far-off lands and adventures.
meanings.sent5: The chef dabbled with new ingredients, creating unique and unexpected dishes.
